summary: Acrylamide forms naturally during high-heat frying or baking of starchy foods like chips, cakes, biscuits, and fries via Maillard reaction. Classified as probable human carcinogen by IARC; linked to cancer and nerve damage in animal studies. Levels higher in golden-brown fried chips and baked crusts. Mitigation via lower temps/process tweaks recommended by regulators.
evidence: Mixed; probable carcinogen, exposure reduction advised
safe_limit: No ADI; benchmark levels set (e.g., EU 750 Âµg/kg in chips); minimize via cooking methods
